replies.body:
Nunu is being played in pro play? Too much jungle diversity nerf him.
 {{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}
Nunu has the highest win rate in the game... he deserves a nerf. This isn't because of pro play.

Ivern actually held the highest win rate before Nunu as a jungler, and Rek'Sai still hasn't been addressed.

Edit: Nunu's playrate is still under 3%, while Ivern's is under 1.5% and Rek'sai's is almost 13%. Diversity isn't the issue. All stats were found off of OP.GG

Why would you play a tank jungler in high elo? He has his smite Q and healing combo and that's about it. After that he's just another tank, which isn't as valuable as someone who brings damage AND cc, like Graves, Rek'sai, etc.

You're actually full of shit, Nunu had over a 7% playrate for the past month, week and even today according to OPGG (https://na.op.gg/statistics/champion/).

He also has a 54%+ winrate in every single elo except Iron.

The champion is absurdly dominant AT ALL ELOS and this nerf wasn't even that bad.

Looking forward to seeing more :)
Trynd's crit chance dilemma is the fact that he relies on crit chance in the first place.

Sure, the Sylas changes work to encourage an AP build but overall they can be seen as buffs.  I find this worrisome as what should be a niche pick (based on opponent's ultimates) is often blind picked in pro.

A fair point, although I feel like in pro play, champions that tend to be strong often have game changing ultimates. For example, I think of Sejuani, who has an ultimate designed for picks or team fights and is overall a strong ult for pro games as it gives guaranteed kills if landed. Pro players know a lot of what they’re doing and many of their champs have ults that can change the tide of a team fight or just getting picks for early leads, and for that reason Sylas is pretty much guaranteed to get decent ultimate options. Pretty much every viable pro champ has great ultimates, save for possibly Jayce, although his ranged form still seems to offer a decent amount for Sylas and will never be unavailable for Sylas to take, making it not half bad regardless.

Sylas faces a problem where it seems like his kit is very linear, but it's actually extremely overbearing in niche cases, and in other cases, he's still overbearing from his base kit that doesn't have an ultimate. This means he's usually at his full power 100% of the time, and doesn't have a lengthy cooldown on when he's viable.
he is just oppressive overall. with all that tankiness and damage, it's just hard to handle him at all if your mele, while ranged tend to pop.
That was my thought. why on earth is Sylas getting buffed?
Coin and spellthief's got buffed last patch and now relic gets nerfed??????
It seems like my team never picks a tank, and this isnt helping

I think that bringing the new mechanics to conqueror was a good idea (adaptive force + stacks + resets for ranged), but it added waaaay too many variables for it to be "balanced" on the champions that were using it before the rework, since its become broken on new champs. 

Old Conqueror gave **18 AD at level 8** (no need to stack to reach that, just 4 seconds in combat). 

Conqueror 2.0 (3-15 adaptive per stack) gave **18 AD at level 6** with 5 stacks (ok sure nerf that).

Conqueror 2.1 (2-10 adaptive per stack) gave **18 AD at level 10** with 5 stacks.

Conqueror 2.2 (2-6 adaptive per stack) will give **18 AD at level 18** with 5 stacks. 

This feels like having to take ranged champions and mages into consideration has ruined the keystone for AD bruisers ( champions like {{champion:122}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:23}} ). When the old Conqueror was born, it finally felt like they had a very good rune to play with. 

In 9.5 however, the rune will be giving half the AD it used to give before the rework, along with 10% less true damage and tiny stacks + healing mechanics to compensate for it. The thing is, most ranged champions and mages already had other runes that suited them really well, but for AD bruisers, Conqueror was practically it (yes, there were other keystones, but Conqueror was at the top). 

In other words, AD bruisers seem to have lost their beloved keystone since it has become too powerful on mages and ranged champions, even though these champions probably won't be using Conqueror that much anyway (since its been nerfed into the grave).

the thing is, the rune is being pushed towards turning some of the damage one deals into true damage and getting healing off of that. Conqueror was easily abusable before because it gave good power and sustain. Its similar to the fleet footwork vs press the attack. One gives you sustain and utility, where as the other one gives you damage. Conqueror is just becoming a rune to give better sustain in long teamfights now.
Still no Death Recap fix huh? Shame. *shrugs*
I know, I love getting ignited or stattik shivved by infernal drake!

MATCHMAKING

We want you to fix MATCHMAKING.

We don't care about the other bullshit.

FIX MATCHMAKING

What, you don't enjoy being thrown in with 4 silvers while in mid to high gold and fighting platinums every game? Shame on you. This system is perfect. I also love gaining 10 LP for a win and losing over 20 for a loss! Really gives me that dopamine rush when I manage to nail a close win and know that I'll have to win two more in a row if I want to make up for even one loss.

Are you serious about not nerfing Vayne? Does the balance team even play this game?
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
Conqueror with 18 AD fully stacked at max level. When your gaining 1.2-3.6AD per stack, its literally invisible. Might as well just all come when it's fully stacked at that point.
lol another month for URF ... say good bye to another keyboard (and a mouse maybe)
We don't like being nerfed.
Then stop performing vehicular manslaughter by snowball

Why not make conqueror only give one stack per ability source (so riven q gives one stack per full cd and yorick gets one stack from passive) so then you dont end up nerfing the champs indirectly that where not out of line.
Not to mention it feels awful fighting Yorick and having him instantly stack conqueror from his little bastards nibbling at your heels.

Hey Riot, League Voice is still not requesting mic permissions on MacOS Mojave. Would love to see a fix for this soon! (This has been an ongoing issue for a lot of people for a while, see thread). Thanks!

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/AZhJrEVr-mic-not-working-on-voice-chat-with-macbook-pro-and-os-mojave?show=flat

you got buff Gangplank right but you missed the mark on where to buff him. his kegs and cannon don't need buff. it his damn Q. *4 Q shots later* "fuck out of ammo (mana)". either increase his mana pool or decrease the mana usage of Q.
Considering his first item is often sheen and a lot of people go kelptomancy his mana problems are not too bad. It's only when you start spamming W you run out fast.
Pretty sure those are Vi nerfs. Lol.

I don't like how RIOT is favorting all damage base champions... There is no defence in the game. There are no champions with enough armor or magic rest to compete. I like playing tanks, but none of them have enough defence. They die in less then 1-2 seconds.

Really the only situation in which tanks are useful is if the enemy team makes the mistake of going all ad or all ap. And even if they do that there are certain champs they can pick who get away with it, such as Vayne or even Yasuo with his conqueror and armor pen ulti. You can pretty much guarantee that, even if they have 4 ad with one ap threat, that ap threat will get fed out of their mind and you'll be forced to build one or two MR items which do no good against the other four fifths of their team.

Man, relic got nerfed to shit. Not sure on how the math looks, but the base 40 going to a minimum of 10 on Targon's is a heavy blow.

The relic changes should have also been based on 0-75% missing health, or anything other than 0-100%. 100% is dead...so...how is that even attainable as a maximum? At least 0 can still overheal.

Might as well make the Targon's do something other than heal at this point. I'm sure people will take it for health and stats but coin is looking a lot better now.

No Aatrox buffs.

No Yasuo nerfs.


I main Vi and was already stomping with her. Thank you for ensuring my Gold status Rito!

Maybe because of:

"Blast Shield's cooldown is now reduced by 3 seconds whenever Denting Blows procs
10% max health ⇒ 15% max health"

"DAMAGE 150/300/450 (+1.4 bonus attack damage) ⇒ 150/325/500 (+1.1 bonus attack damage)

SECONDARY TARGET KNOCKBACK Vi knocks back enemies she passes through by 250 range over 0.25 seconds ⇒ 350 range over 0.75 seconds
" 
as the trade offs...

Yasuo didn't need it.

The changes on Vi are an overall nerf.

I've mained Vi for a long time. This is not a nerf. They've shifted some things around but she's overall the same.

Play Aatrox and get back to me.

Play against a Yasuo while you're at it.

https://twitter.com/supermetroidlol

I dont like Vi changes.

It's an overall nerf. They take away from her full blown dmg and u HAVE to build on-hit or crit to take advantage of the tradeoff. Basically making her a glass canon.

This is definitely a nerf. I mean its not like she's building any crit to begin with.
Uh, if it only last for two seconds for ranged champions, how is Conqueror going to be used by mages? It feels like it's being ranged towards only melee now
not a single meele/ranged mage had conqueror as its highest winrate keystone and yet they gutted it for ap champs...
